author: @mathrubhumi
title: മസ്‌ക് കള്ളം പ്രചരിപ്പിക്കുന്നുവെന്ന് സ്വന്തം കമ്പനിയുടെ എഐ ചാറ്റ്ബോട്ട്
text: ഓപ്പണ് എഐയുടെ ചാറ്റ് ജിപിടിയെ വെല്ലുവിളിച്ചാണ് ഇലോണ് മസ്ക് ഗ്രോക്ക് എന്ന പേരില് പുതിയ ആര്ട്ടിഫിഷ്യല് ഇന്റലിജന്സ് മോഡല് അവതരിപ്പിച്ചത്. എന്നാല് ഒരു ഉപഭോക്താവിന്റെ ചോദ്യത്തിന് ഗ്രോക്ക് എഐ നല്കിയ മറുപടി മസ്കിന് കനത്ത പ്രഹരമായിരിക്കുകയാണ്. കോടിക്കണക്കിന് ജനങ്ങള്ക്കിടയില് ഇലോണ് മസ്ക് തെറ്റായ വിവരങ്ങള് പ്രചരിപ്പിക്കുന്നുണ്ടോ എന്നായിരുന്നു ഗാരി കോപ്നിക് എന്നയാളുടെ ചോദ്യം. ഇതിന് ഉണ്ടെന്നാണ് ഗ്രോക്ക് മറുപടി നല്കിയത്. ഇലോണ് മസ്ക് തന്റെ സോഷ്യല് മീഡിയ പ്ലാറ്റ്ഫോമായ എക്സ് (മുമ്പ് ട്വിറ്റര്) വഴി തിരഞ്ഞെടുപ്പുകള് ഉള്പ്പെടെ വിവിധ വിഷയങ്ങളില് വളരെ വലിയ പ്രേക്ഷകരിലേക്ക് തെറ്റായ വിവരങ്ങള് പ്രചരിപ്പിച്ചു എന്നതിന് കാര്യമായ തെളിവുകളും വിശകലനങ്ങളും ഉണ്ടെന്ന് ഗ്രോക്ക് മറുപടി നല്കി. അത് വിശദീകരിക്കുകയും ചെയ്തു. Content Highlights: Elon Musk`s Grok AI Confirms He Spreads Misinformation Share this Article RELATED STORIES വാര്ത്തകളോടു പ്രതികരിക്കുന്നവര് അശ്ലീലവും അസഭ്യവും നിയമവിരുദ്ധവും അപകീര്ത്തികരവും സ്പര്ധ വളര്ത്തുന്നതുമായ പരാമര്ശങ്ങള് ഒഴിവാക്കുക. വ്യക്തിപരമായ അധിക്ഷേപങ്ങള് പാടില്ല. ഇത്തരം അഭിപ്രായങ്ങള് സൈബര് നിയമപ്രകാരം ശിക്ഷാര്ഹമാണ്. വായനക്കാരുടെ അഭിപ്രായങ്ങള് വായനക്കാരുടേതു മാത്രമാണ്, മാതൃഭൂമിയുടേതല്ല. ദയവായി മലയാളത്തിലോ ഇംഗ്ലീഷിലോ മാത്രം അഭിപ്രായം എഴുതുക. മംഗ്ലീഷ് ഒഴിവാക്കുക..

author: MarketScreener
title: Soy futures recover from June low as rains benefit Brazil crops - 03/01/2024 | MarketScreener
text:
Soy futures recover from June low as rains benefit Brazil crops January 03, 2024 at 05:24 pm Share CHICAGO, Jan 3 (Reuters) - Chicago Board of Trade soybean futures edged higher on Wednesday, after favorable rains in dry areas of top-exporter Brazil sent the market to its lowest levels since June.
Corn futures also rose slightly after setting a contract low in earlier trading, while wheat extended losses to a one-month low.
Rains should continue to benefit soybean and corn crops in northern Brazil this week, analysts said, after hot, dry weather has prompted analysts to slash their production estimates.
"The better weather in South America and the lack of any new export sales announcements make it difficult to be a buyer in the short run," said Tomm Pfitzenmaier, analyst for Summit Commodity Brokerage in Iowa.
CBOT March soybean futures were up 4-1/2 cents at $12.78 a bushel by 11:10 a.m. CST (1710 GMT) after the contract fell earlier to its lowest price since June 28 at $12.65-3/4.
The market saw some short-term buying after its sell-off, brokers said.
Higher supplies from other South American producers are likely to offset crop losses in Brazil, said Arlan Suderman, chief commodities economist for StoneX.
"Buyers have not yet seen the need to increase imports of U.S. soybeans to compensate for a 'short' Brazil crop," Suderman said.
"Part of the reason for that has been expectations for the Argentine crop to nearly double this year to close to 50 million metric tons, while increased production is also expected in Paraguay and Uruguay."
Strength in the U.S. dollar also hung over agricultural markets, analysts said. The dollar rose to a two-week high, underpinned by elevated U.S. Treasury yields.
CBOT March wheat dropped 6-1/4 cents to $6.00-1/2 a bushel and hit its lowest price since Dec. 1. March corn was up 1-1/4 cents at $4.65 a bushel after setting a contract low of $4.61-3/4.
Speculators have entered 2024 with some of their most bearish-ever views towards CBOT corn, but in past years, that positioning has rarely proven sustainable. (Reporting by Tom Polansek in Chicago; Additional reporting by Peter Hobson in Canberra and Sybille de La Hamaide in Paris; Editing by Varun H K, Alexandra Hudson and David Evans)
Share © Reuters - 2024

author: BBC News Mundo
title: Argentina: protestas contra las reformas de Javier Milei en menos de un mes de Gobierno
text:
France 24 Argentina: protestas contra las reformas de Javier Milei en menos de un mes de Gobierno Leer todo el artículo France 24 28 de diciembre de 2023, 11:52 p. m.
Hace poco más de dos semanas Javier Milei asumió la Presidencia de Argentina y en ese corto periodo ya ha sumado tres jornadas de multitudinarias protestas contra sus reformas planteadas en el Decreto de Necesidad y Urgencia. Los sindicatos de trabajadores argentinos han salido a las calles a expresar su descontento con las medidas adoptadas por el Ejecutivo y contra los proyectos de la Administración Milei que se encuentran en debate en el Congreso.
Leer más sobre FRANCE 24 Español

author: Geeta Pillai
title: Climate Fears Escalate as Australians Face Relocation due to Extreme Weather, Survey Reveals
text:
Australians are increasingly apprehensive about the prospect of extreme weather events forcing them to abandon their homes, a recent survey by the Climate Council indicates. Approximately 33% of respondents expressed concern over potential permanent relocation, while 40% have already experienced or know someone who has had to move temporarily or permanently due to such disasters. Rising insurance costs and the impact on younger generations also emerged as significant worries.
Advertisment Survey Insights and Community Sentiments The Climate Council's survey, engaging 1,568 Australians, shines a light on the pervasive impact of climate-related disasters since 2019, with heatwaves topping the list of concerns. Particularly in Queensland and New South Wales, residents have borne the brunt of extreme weather, including floods, cyclones, and droughts. Retired Major General Peter Dunn, reflecting on the increased anxiety within these communities, underscored the urgent need for political leaders to heed these warnings and address the potential for significant population shifts, especially in rural areas.
Insurance Industry's Role and Responses Advertisment The escalating cost of home insurance due to worsening disasters has alarmed 84% of survey participants. Despite efforts to disaster-proof homes, many find their insurance premiums unaffordable. In response, insurers like NRMA Insurance and Suncorp Group have initiated discounts for households adopting the Bushfire Resilience Rating assessment to enhance their homes' fire resilience. This move, along with potential government investments, signals a shift towards more sustainable community preparedness and disaster management strategies.
Community Preparedness and Future Outlook Despite the grim findings, the survey revealed a silver lining with 76% of respondents confident in their community's preparedness for future climate-related disasters. This underscores the importance of continued investment in resilience-building and the insurance industry's recognition of risk reduction measures. As Australia grapples with these challenges, the combined efforts of governments, insurers, and communities will be pivotal in navigating the path towards greater climate resilience.

author: Svyatenko Tamara
title: Fierce frosts and ice forecaster warned when Ukraine will be hit by real winter
text:
Fierce frosts and ice: forecaster warned when Ukraine will be hit by real winter.
The weather forecast for the coming days in Ukraine is not very favorable. According to forecaster Igor Kibalchich, a significant drop in temperature and ice are expected.
According to forecasts, from December 13, there will be a noticeable decrease in temperature in Ukraine. Thermometers will show -12 degrees, but the weather will remain dry without significant precipitation.
Cold weather is also expected by the end of the week. At night, temperatures in some regions may drop to -5...-10 degrees, while in the Carpathians it could drop to -12 degrees. During the day, temperatures will also decrease, except in the south and Crimea, where a stable warm regime will remain.
Weather on December 12
On Thursday night, light rain is expected in most regions, which will turn into wet snow. During the day, precipitation is expected only in the east and in the Sea of Azov region. Ice may occur in the west and north of the country. Wind speeds will be 7-12 m/s.
Air temperature during the day will vary between -1...+4 degrees, while in some places in the south it may reach +5...+7 degrees.
December 13
Before the weekend, cool and changeable weather without precipitation is expected, but with possible ice on the roads. Wind speeds will decrease to 5-10 m/s. At night, temperatures will drop to 0...-5 degrees, while in the Carpathians it will be even colder - from -7 to -12 degrees. During the day, thermometers will show from -3 to +2 degrees.
December 14
On Saturday, dry weather is forecasted, but during the day in the Carpathians and Transcarpathia there will be wet snow and rain, as well as possible ice. Wind speeds will be 7-12 m/s. Nights will be cool with temperatures from -1 to -6 degrees, and in the eastern regions and Carpathians, it will be even colder - temperatures will drop to -5...-10 degrees. During the day, thermometers will show from -1 to +4 degrees, while in the south it may be warmer - from +5 to +7 degrees.
December 15
By the end of the week, precipitation in the form of snow, wet snow, and rain is expected. Wet snow may accumulate in places, and there may be ice on the roads. The air temperature at night will fluctuate between -2...+3 degrees, and during the day it will rise to +1...+6 degrees. In the south and Crimea, +5...+10 degrees is expected.
We also remind you that geomagnetic storms are possible in the coming days.

author: Kyra Kyra
title: Cricut unveils its new creative machines: explore 4 and maker 4
text:
A new generation of smart cutting machines arrives at Cricut. Maker 4 as well as explore 4 take advantage of new performance to maintain leadership on the market.
In the field of smart cutting machines, the Cricut brand is one of the reference manufacturers. This has just announced two new products in their catalog: explore 4 and Maker 4.
DIY, anglicism of “do the yourself” experiences a second breath with the arrival of intelligent cutting machine and the return of 3D printers. If you are not familiar with this universe, these are products capable of cutting shapes and drawings to then decorate more types of objects. Clothes, mugs or even stickers everything goes through these machines. Within the market, Cricut is one of the references with a catalog for all types of budgets.
An improved cutting speed
These new cutting machines arrive with real technical improvements first. Maker 4 and explore 4 have a cutting speed twice as fast as the previous models. Similarly, the arrival of these new products coincide with an update of the Cricut Design Space application to make it more intuitive to use.
Above all, the user experience is improved since the machines are delivered with a starter kit. You will find Smart Vinyl cutting papers, cardboard paper, thermocoling, transfer band, and tools such as the light grip cutting carpet.
Price and availability
The Cricut Explore 4 and the Cricut Maker 4 will be available from March 14, respectively available at 299 euros and 449 euros, sold in single machines as well as in packs on the Cricut.com site, via the boutique on Amazon and the main resellers.
See you on a two Wednesday on Twitch, from 6 p.m. to 8 p.m., to follow live The show that boosts produced by Aroged. Electric car, electric bike, expert opinion, games or testimonies, there is something for everyone!
